body.section:
Once you got Nerrvana plugin installed in Jenkins, you can use it as a build step and run your Selenium tests in Nerrvana.
We assume that
You know how to add Nerrvana plugin as the build step to the Jenkins job
You know how to obtain code of your Selenium tests into Jenkins workspace (e.g. pull tests code from SVN to Jenkins using Jenkins SVN plugin);
You have account at Nerrvana.
To initialize Nerrvana plugin you should obtain plugin settings from Nerrvana
open Nerrvana Dashboard, point to any test run name with mouse(at least demo test runs should be there) and click pencil on the panel which appear to the left of the test run name. This will open "Edit test run" page.
On "Edit test run" page edit parameters as you want (or don't edit them at all - you may edit them later directly in generated config XML). To get the configuration XML click "Generate Jenkins plugin config".
Add build step "Nerrvana plug-in" to your Jenkins job.
Copy/paste generated plugin config into "Nerrvana plugin settings" of "Nerrvana plug-in" build step.
